newsitem.title: FRANCE: French stocks close higher after weak day.
newsitem.headline: French stocks close higher after weak day.

text.p: French shares closed higher after having spent most of the day in the red as a stronger dollar in the afternoon provided support in the absence of any Wall Street influence, dealers said.
The dollar broke a 34-month record above 1.70 marks.
The blue-chip CAC-40 index closed up 7.06 points or 0.27 percent at 2,634.48 while the CAC-40 futures contract was up at 2,642 from 2,631 on Friday's close.
Total volume was 6.32 billion francs and 4.3 billion in CAC-40 shares.
* Renault is biggest loser among blue-chips, falling 2.94 percent to 118.90 as analysts slash their results forecasts after a company profit warning on Friday.
* GAN fell 4.53 percent to 118 francs, after six percent on Friday, on a repeated profit warning and worries about a needed capital injection.
* Alcatel Alsthom gained 2.39 percent to 601 francs, below a fresh year high of 608 francs, partly in reaction to this weekend's global telecommunications pact.
* BNP gained 3.33 percent to 244.90 francs, surpassing its 1993 flotation price of 240 francs for the first time since July 1995.
It has clawed its way back from a low of 171.50 last August. Since the start of the year it has gained more than 22 percent.
"The climb observed over the last few weeks is just basically catchup," said one analyst. Another analyst said BNP "was most behind the others in gaining ground."
* Accor, up four percent at 780, was boosted by technical factors, dealers said.
